section.section: The Commission consists of seven members appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate.
The presiding officer of either house of the General Assembly may recommend to the Governor a list of individuals for appointment to the Commission.
No more than five members may be of the same political party.
The members of the Commission shall reflect the geographic, racial, and gender makeup of the State.
A member of the Commission shall file a financial disclosure statement with the State Ethics Commission in accordance with Title 15, Subtitle 6 of this article.

The term of a member is 5 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Commission on October 1, 2012.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member may not serve for more than two full terms.
Subject to the hearing requirements of this subsection, the Governor may remove a member for cause.
Before the Governor removes a member, the Governor shall give the member notice and an opportunity for a public hearing.

text.section: The Governor shall appoint one member of the Commission to serve as a liaison to the State Racing Commission established under Title 11 of the Business Regulation Article.
The Commission shall include at least one member who resides in a local jurisdiction in which a video lottery facility is located.
